sentences.en: A minority of officers were prepared to bend the rules.
sentences.cn: 少数官员准备篡改规则。

sentences.en: Boys are very much in the minority at the dancing class.
sentences.cn: 舞蹈班里男生占极少数.

sentences.en: Even in the 1960s, politically active students and academics were in a minority.
sentences.cn: 即使在20世纪60年代，热衷于政治的学生与大学教师也是少数。

sentences.en: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
sentences.cn: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

sentences.en: In the past conservatives have been in the minority.
sentences.cn: 过去保守派一直占少数。

sentences.en: Only a small minority of the mentally ill are liable to harm themselves or others.
sentences.cn: 在精神病患者中，只有一小部分有可能会伤害自己或他人。

sentences.en: Only a tiny minority hold such extreme views.
sentences.cn: 只有极少数人持这样极端的观点。

sentences.en: Such persons are certainly in the minority.
The minority is subordinate to the majority.
The minority should submit to the majority.
The rise of racism concerns Sikhs because they are such a visible minority.
sentences.cn: 种族主义的抬头让锡克教徒很担忧，因为他们是力量非常薄弱的少数群体。

sentences.en: The South African president has negotiated an end to white-minority rule.
sentences.cn: 南非总统已通过谈判达成协议，结束了少数白人的统治。

sentences.en: These children are only a small minority.
sentences.cn: 这些孩子只是很少的一部分。

sentences.en: They are in a decided minority.
We cannot make this minority a convenient excuse to turn our backs.
sentences.cn: 我们不能拿少数这几个人作为一种方便的借口而对此置之不理。

words.tran_cn: 未成年的；次要的；较小的；小调的；二流的
未成年人；小调；副修科目

phrases.phrase: be (或 find oneself) in a minority of one
phrases.tran_cn: (常幽默)是孤家寡人；得不到任何支持
少数民族语言；少数人的语言；小语种

trans.tran_en: a small group of people or things within a much larger group
